name: Oklahoma National Guard Tuition Waiver
description: Resident tuition waived up to 18 credits per semester at Oklahoma public institutions for National Guard members in good standing.
eligibility: Active Oklahoma National Guard member in good standing
how_to_apply: Apply through Oklahoma National Guard Education Office at ok.ng.mil/eap/

name: Heroes Promise Scholarship
description: Tuition scholarship for children of Oklahoma military members killed in action on or after January 1, 2000. Service member must have filed Oklahoma tax return for year of death or year prior. Student must enroll before age 21 in Oklahoma State System of Higher Education.
eligibility: Child of Oklahoma military member KIA after Jan 1, 2000
Service member filed OK tax return year of/before death
Enroll before age 21 in OK state institution
benefit_amount: Tuition assistance at Oklahoma public institutions
source_name: Oklahoma State Regents for Higher Education

name: Credit for Military Training and Experience
description: Veterans with honorable discharge may receive credit for education, training, and experience from military service toward degree from Oklahoma college. Must enroll within 3 years of discharge.
eligibility: Military training relevant to degree program
how_to_apply: Work with Oklahoma institution admissions/veterans office
source_name: Oklahoma State Regents for Higher Education

name: 100% Disabled Veteran Property Tax Exemption
description: FULL property tax exemption (entire fair cash value of homestead) for 100% permanently disabled veterans and surviving spouses. Disability must be sustained through military action, accident, or disease during active service. Annual refiling required.
eligibility: Own and occupy homestead as primary residence
benefit_amount: 100% property tax exemption on full homestead value
how_to_apply: File OTC Form 998 annually with county assessor

name: Active Duty Military Pay Tax Exemption
description: 100% of income received as active duty military pay by Oklahoma resident is completely exempt from Oklahoma state income tax. This applies to ALL components of Armed Forces.
eligibility: Active duty in any component of U.S. Armed Forces
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on ALL active duty military pay
how_to_apply: Exclude from Oklahoma income tax return

name: Military Retirement Pay Partial Exemption
description: Retirement benefits from military service exempt from Oklahoma income tax in amount not to exceed the GREATER of 75% of benefits OR $10,000.
benefit_amount: Greater of 75% of retirement pay OR $10,000 exempt
how_to_apply: Claim exemption on Oklahoma income tax return

name: 100% Disabled Veteran Sales Tax Exemption
description: Annual sales tax exemption (including city and county) up to $25,000 for 100% permanently disabled veterans. Unremarried surviving spouses eligible for up to $1,000/year. Exempts SALES taxes only (city and county), NOT excise taxes.
how_to_apply: Apply online at oklahoma.gov/tax/ or Form 13-5; can add household member card

name: Motor Vehicle Excise Tax Exemption
description: 100% disabled veterans exempt from motor vehicle excise tax. Exemption may be claimed on one vehicle in consecutive 3-year period. Vehicle must be purchased on/after July 1, 2005.
eligibility: Veteran listed as owner on title
benefit_amount: Excise tax exemption on one vehicle every 3 years
how_to_apply: Present VA letter to local tag agency when registering vehicle

name: Veterans Employment Preference - 5 Points
description: Veterans or their unremarried surviving spouses receive 5 points added to state employment examination scores.
eligibility: Honorably discharged veteran OR unremarried surviving spouse
benefit_amount: 5 points added to employment test scores
how_to_apply: Indicate veteran status on state job application

name: Disabled War Veterans Employment Preference - 10 Points
description: Disabled war veterans receive 10 points added to state employment exams. Veterans with 30%+ disability automatically placed at TOP of selection list (Absolute Preference).
benefit_amount: 10 points on exams; 30%+ disability = TOP of hiring list
how_to_apply: Submit veteran and disability documentation with state application

name: Free State Parks and Museums Admission
description: ALL honorably discharged veterans who are Oklahoma residents receive FREE admission to all state-owned or state-operated parks and museums.
benefit_amount: FREE admission to all OK state parks and museums
how_to_apply: Show DD-214 or veteran ID at park/museum entrance

name: Disabled Veteran Hunting and Fishing Licenses
description: Legal resident veterans with 60%+ disability exempt from Wildlife Land Stamp requirements. License fees: $200 for under 60% disability; $25 for 60%+ disability; FREE for 100% disabled.
how_to_apply: Apply through Oklahoma Wildlife Department with VA documentation

name: Oklahoma Veterans' Homes
description: Seven state veterans' homes providing skilled nursing care located in Ardmore, Claremore, Clinton, Lawton, Norman, Sulphur, and Sallisaw.
benefit_amount: Subsidized skilled nursing care (7 locations statewide)
how_to_apply: Contact Oklahoma Department of Veterans Affairs

name: ODVA Financial Assistance Program
description: Oklahoma Department of Veterans Affairs provides financial assistance to veterans and families in times of financial hardship, covering emergency needs like rent, utilities, and medical bills.
how_to_apply: Contact Oklahoma Department of Veterans Affairs county office

name: Special Veteran License Plates
description: Oklahoma Tax Commission issues many official special license plates for veterans. FREE license and renewal for 100% disabled military/veteran. Plates may not be transferred but can be moved to another vehicle after re-registration. Applications by October 1 for following calendar year.
benefit_amount: Special veteran plates; FREE for 100% disabled
how_to_apply: Apply through Oklahoma Tax Commission by October 1
